de.weltraumschaf.dht.event

Interface Observable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultObservable

    public interface Observable
    This interface represents an observable object.
    Author:
    Sven Strittmatter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(Observer o)
      Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set.
      int countObservers()
      Returns the number of observers of this Observable object.
      void deleteObserver(Observer observer)
      Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object.
      void deleteObservers()
      Clears the observer list so that this object no longer has any observers.
      boolean hasChanged()
      Tests if this object has changed.
      void notifyObservers(Event event)
      If this object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged() method, then notify all of its observers.

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        void addObserver(Observer o)
        Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set. The order in which notifications will be delivered to multiple observers is not specified.
        Parameters:
        o - an observer to be added CHECKSTYLE:OFF
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if, the parameter o is null. CHECKSTYLE:ON

      • countObservers

        int countObservers()
        Returns the number of observers of this Observable object.
        Returns:
        the number of observers of this object.

      • deleteObserver

        void deleteObserver(Observer observer)
        Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object.
        Parameters:
        observer - must not be null

      • deleteObservers

        void deleteObservers()
        Clears the observer list so that this object no longer has any observers.

      • hasChanged

        boolean hasChanged()
        Tests if this object has changed.
        Returns:
        true if object has changed, else false

      • notifyObservers

        void notifyObservers(Event event)
        If this object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged() method, then notify all of its observers. Each observer has its Observer.update(de.weltraumschaf.dht.event.Event) method called with one event arguments.
        Parameters:
        event - must not be null
